content.description: Hannah, a first grade student, got out of her classroom seat many times without permission. Her teacher raised her eyebrows before taking Hannah to the principalâ€™s office. The next day another student, Sarah, started to get out of her seat without permission. As soon as the teacher raised her eyebrows, Sarah quickly returned to her seat and the rest of the class sat quietly.
content.question: Which of the following concepts best applies to the behavior of the class?

topic.text: 3.9: Social, Cognitive, and Neurological Factors in Learning

skill.text: 1.A: Apply psychological perspectives, theories, concepts, and research findings to a scenario.
